thread.title: Yankees fan's obituary takes one last dig at A-Rod
thread.title_full: Yankees fan's obituary takes one last dig at A-Rod

title: Yankees fan's obituary takes one last dig at A-Rod
text:
By Sarah Larimer October 6 at 3:46 PM Follow @slarimer (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II) 
R.I.P., Helen Fowler, a true Yankees fan who loved her team, except Alex Rodriguez. 
No kidding, it literally says that in her obituary . In addition to being a devoted wife, mother and grandmother, Helen Fowler was apparently also devoted to solid trash talk. 
Fowler — whose Yankees, for what it’s worth, meet the Houston Astros on Tuesday night in the AL wild-card game — died Sept. 29 in New Jersey; The 85-year-old’s obituary was published in the Newark Star-Ledger . 
“Mrs. Fowler was a former member of the Cranford First Aid Squad and a lifelong Yankees fan, with the exception of Alex Rodriguez,” it reads . (Screenshot) 
She does seem like kind of an ace baseball fan, right? (Sorry, Alex Rodriguez.) You can read the full obit here .
